cybergis_compute_client.JAT module

class cybergis_compute_client.JAT.JAT[source]

Job Access Token (JAT) class .. attribute:: accessTokenCache

All cached access tokens with the date submitted as keys

type

dict

id

Unique identifier for the job assigned by the client

Type

str

secretToken

Token to generate JAT signature provided by the client

Type

str

algorithm

Algorithm used to hash the signature

Type

str

getAccessToken()[source]

Returns the access token signaure of this job, and adds it to the cache if it is not already there

Returns

Access token signature, in the form of 4 Base64-URL strings separated by dots

Return type

(str)

getDate()[source]

Returns the current date (year, month, day, hour) :param none:

Returns

The current date

Return type

(str)

hash(payload)[source]

Constructs a compact access token with the given payload :param payload: payload to be hashed :type payload: str

Returns

(str) hashed payload

init(algorithm, id, secretToken)[source]

Initializes instance data with data from the client :param accessTokenCache: All cached access tokens with the dates submitted as keys :type accessTokenCache: dict :param id: Unique identifier for the job (assigned by the client) :type id: str :param secretToken: Token to generate JAT signature (provided by the client) :type secretToken: str :param algorithm: Algorithm used to hash the signature :type algorithm: str

Returns

this JAT

Return type

(obj)

parseAccessToken(accessToken)[source]

Returns decoded information from the access token in the form of a dictionary :param accessToken: The job’s access token, in the form of 4 Base64-URL strings separated by dots :type accessToken: str

Returns

Algorithm, payload (both encoded and decoded), id, and the hash associated with a job’s secret token, id, and payload.

Return type

(dict)

cybergis_compute_client.Zip module

This module exposes Zip class which creates an in-memory zip object to avoid disk access

Example

zip = Zip()

class cybergis_compute_client.Zip.Zip[source]

Zip class An interface that creates an in-memory zip object to avoid disk access

in_memory_zip

A BytesIO in-memory file

Inits Zip with in_memory_zip

append(filename_in_zip, file_contents)[source]

Appends a file with name filename_in_zip and contents of file_contents to the in-memory zip. :param filename_in_zip: Name of the zip_file :type filename_in_zip: str :param file_contents: Contents that need to be written to the zip_file :type file_contents: str

Returns

this Zip

Return type

(obj)

mkdir(filedir_in_zip)[source]

Creates a directory with the name filedir_in_zip :param fildir_in_zip: Name of the zip_directory :type fildir_in_zip: str

Returns

this Zip

Return type

(obj)

read()[source]

Reads the contents of the in-memory zip. :param None:

Returns

contents of the in-memory zip

Return type

(str)

write(filename)[source]

Writes the in-memory zip to a file :param filename: Name of the file that needs to be written :type filename: str

Returns

None
